intro: Gerardia brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, upright growth habit. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Gerardia brevifolia is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
